intro: Lepidaploa psilostachya, commonly known as the narrowleaf false panicgrass, is a perennial grass native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has fibrous roots and is often found in open landscapes such as grasslands and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
